page.title: 05Bath College of H. E.
page.content: The survey area is rural farm land. There are two villages English Combe and Newton-St-Loe. The only other big cluster of buildings is Bath College of Higher Education. This used to be a stately home. The whole area is part of the Duke of Cornwall's estate. The Duke of Cornwall is Prince Charles, The Prince of Wales and he is the landlord. He takes a keen interest in the estate, and often visits the area. Apart from those working and studying in the college, most people earn their living on the farms. There are dairy herds, mostly black and white Fresians. The main crops are wheat, barley and oil seed rape.
